intro: Hufelandia ovalis, commonly known as the oval hufelandia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring upright, hairy stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Hufelandia ovalis thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
